result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix

defendant.name: Hendrix, Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman
defendant.address: 3838 North Port Washington Road, Milwaukee, WI 53212

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Russell Barker   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned to 12-5-22 at 8:30 am for a status conference, by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for State v Lee hearing. Court advises parties that although today was calendared for a State v Lee hearing, SPD office has appointed successor counsel. Attorney Golden further requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case adjourned to Br 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.
Received and Filed. STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER - ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL
filed.

Defendant Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status of Counsel held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court will schedule case for State v. Lee hearing.  Public defenders office notified of next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Status conference on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix not in court.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense counsel has not yet been appointed.  Defendant unable to connect via Zoom.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status of counsel.  No attorney has been apointed yet. Case is adjourned to 7-18-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel by video conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Court finds GOOD CAUSE to toll time limits.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
*Entry made in error
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  (OVERRIDE).   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with AML (DOB: 06/16/1999)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 5000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jarvonie Wamen-Tillman Hendrix not in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
